, with a population of 8000. Yandina was the first town to be built in the Sunshine Coast.
Yandina is situated directly along the
. Yandina Station on the Nambour and Gympie North Line has passenger train services to Brisbane. There are local buses available to Yandina.

, the largest ginger factory in the Southern Hemisphere. Access is free, however optional activities including train tours do cost money. Also available are various rides, shops and tours inside the complex. A must try is the locally famous ginger icecreams, which come in a variety of flavours.
The Yandina Markets are great place to get fresh local produce, local crafts and second hand goods. They take place every Saturday 7am to 12pm, at the Yandina sports grounds, off the Bruce highway.

value: content=Cooked by a local Thai resident, Thai Tong serves authentic and delicious Thai food in an a traditional setting. Great for a quick meal or a night out.
content=Serves up food such as burgers and fish and chips as well as coffee and tea.
